pages.text:
St. Augustine’s Oldest Irish Pub
About Us
The main goal
that Kelli has for Ann O’Malley’s is to keep this a fun place for locals and visitors to enjoy some time in our city.
Meet Kelli
Proprietor: Kelli Meacham
Kelli is a lifelong resident of St. Augustine. After 16 years of service as a St. Johns County Deputy, Kelli started her own business and is now the proud owner of Ann O’Malley’s Pub. Kelli’s loves are animals, the beach, and this city. Her favorite place on the planet is the St. Augustine bayfront. Kelli is also a huge Gators Fan, so on any given Saturday in the fall you can be assured that the Gator game will be on the “Big” TV!
Good Music, great food, and cold beer are always here at O’Malley’s.  Come on out and hang with Kelli and the gang on the porch. To Kelli, this is not a business, it’s her family. Come on in and let us be your home away from home!
Our Story
Over the Years
^
1878
Built as a family home
Home to A.B.
Colee
. His family started the St. Augustine Transfer Company. Then a way to get to St. Augustine from Picolata. Today a horse carriage company.
^
1992
Opened as Ann O’Malley’s Pub
Named after the original owners step mother-in-law, Ann O’Malley’s soon became the favorite of the locals in St. Augustine.
^
2017
Kelli Took Over Ownership
After changing hands a number of times, Kelli took over ownership of the pub and made it into what it is today. Ann O’Malley’s was voted Best Pub in St. Augustine by Folio Weekly in 2019.
^
2021
We made it through the Pandemic!
When other pubs and restaurants were forced to close permanently, Ann O’Malley’s stood strong and is back better than ever! Come and see for yourself.
